page.title: 11THE POLICE H.Q., MAIDSTONE
page.content: The headquarters in the Sutton Road is the communications and administrative centre for the Kent County Constabulary. The original building came into use in 1939 but the operations room dates from 1976. The most recent addition is a second aerial mast adjacent to the operations room and it is hoped that this will overcome previous difficulties with interference from France. The operations room is manned in shifts of eight hours, each watch is under control of a duty inspector. There are direct links with the national police computer at Hendon for immediate vehicle and person checks. Emergency and 999 calls are handled here. Two-way radio links with police vehicles are dealt with at four consoles according to the car's geographical position.
